definitionEng: An identifier for a computer or device on a TCP/IP network.
A hardware address that uniquely identifies each device on a network.
A device that forwards data packets between computer networks.
A device that connects devices together on a computer network.
A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic.
A segmented piece of a larger network.
A node that serves as an access point to another network.
Domain Name System: the phonebook of the internet.
Protocol that automatically assigns IP addresses to devices.
The maximum rate of data transfer across a network.
Delay before a transfer of data begins following an instruction.
Virtual Private Network: extends a private network across a public network.
Transmission Control Protocol: reliable, connection-oriented protocol.
User Datagram Protocol: connectionless, less reliable protocol.
A formatted unit of data carried by a packet-switched network.
A communication endpoint in computer networking.
Local Area Network: network in a small geographic area.
Wide Area Network: spans a large geographic area.
Network Address Translation: modifies network address information.
A conceptual framework used to understand network interactions.
A network utility to test reachability of a host.
A network diagnostic tool for tracking the path to a destination.
Service Set Identifier: name of a wireless network.
Family of standards for wireless networking.
A widely used LAN technology.
A device that connects two LANs.
An intermediary server separating end users from the websites they browse.
Distributes network or application traffic across servers.
Denial-of-Service: attack intended to shut down a machine or network.
An attacker intercepts communication between two parties.
Secure Sockets Layer: protocol for securing internet communication.
Transport Layer Security: successor to SSL.
Internet Protocol version 4: uses 32-bit addresses.
Internet Protocol version 6: uses 128-bit addresses.
Classless Inter-Domain Routing: method for allocating IP addresses.
Defines range of IP addresses in a subnet.
Border Gateway Protocol: manages how packets are routed across the internet.
File Transfer Protocol: transfers files over the Internet.
Hypertext Transfer Protocol: foundation of data communication for the web.
HTTP Secure: encrypted HTTP.
Internet Control Message Protocol: used for error messages and diagnostics.
One endpoint of a two-way communication link.
Protocol providing full-duplex communication over a single TCP connection.
A communication endpoint in computer networking.
An attacker intercepts communication between two parties.
User Datagram Protocol: connectionless, less reliable protocol.
